DataElement.preferredName: Nausea Vomiting Risk Factor History of Alcohol Use Alcohol Consumption Frequency
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sensation that one is about to vomit._The reflex act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth._Anything that increases a person's chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer include a family history of cancer, use of tobacco products, certain foods, exposure to radiation or cancer-causing agents, and certain genetic alterations._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Consumption of liquids containing ethanol, including the behaviors associated with drinking the alcohol._consumption of liquids containing ethanol; includes the behavior of drinking the alcohol._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Upper abdominal discomfort associated with an urge to vomit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. For each, generally denoting a ratio.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
